item.title: Covid: Self-isolation ends for double-jabbed and under-18s
item.description: Rules change in England and Northern Ireland for contacts of people who test positive for Covid.

item.title: Covid: 16 and 17-year-olds in England to be offered jab by 23 August
item.description: Those in England will be offered a jab or the chance to book one by 23 August, the government says.

item.title: Twitter's new design to get fix after headache complaints
item.description: Unveiled last week, the redesign involved high-contrast colours and a custom-designed font, Chirp.

item.title: Covid: Daughter of Oxfordshire man urges caution
item.description: David Allum, 58, died after complications from Covid-19 despite receiving both vaccine doses.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Parents upset at jabs wait for high-risk children
item.description: Some families are struggling to get vaccines for vulnerable teens, nearly a month after they became eligible.

item.title: Don't ignore cancer signs, says new NHS England boss
item.description: About 10% fewer people with cancer than normal have been seen over the past year, figures show.

item.title: Covid: Carrie Johnson urges pregnant women to get vaccinated
item.description: The PM's wife, who is expecting a baby, says she is "feeling great" after having her second vaccine.

item.title: Cost of NHS Covid tests for UK arrivals reduced
item.description: Sajid Javid reduces the cost of NHS travel tests ahead of a review into the pricing of all test providers.

item.title: Metabolism peaks at age one and tanks after 60, study finds
item.description: Middle-aged spread cannot be blamed on a waning metabolism, according to researchers.

item.title: Teenage jab rollout moving cautiously - expert
item.description: Children aged 16 and 17 began to be invited for their jabs a week ago, after a change in advice.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Fertility and miscarriage claims fact-checked
item.description: Posts claiming Covid vaccines cause miscarriages are not supported by scientific evidence.

item.title: Is the coronavirus pandemic over at last?
item.description: As Scotland loosens most of its remaining restrictions, is the devastating pandemic finally at an end?

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: Covid-19: The mystery of rising infections in India's Kerala
item.description: Covid-19 cases continue to rise in Kerala despite the waning of the second wave elsewhere in India.

item.title: Covid vaccines: Tourists head to the US to get vaccinated
item.description: Some tourists are spending thousands of dollars to travel to the US to get a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Concussion and sport: How the lives of ex-sportspeople have been affected by concussion
item.description: BBC Radio 5 Live speaks to former sportsmen and women and their families about how concussion has changed their lives.

item.title: Covid: Where and why is the US vaccine rollout slowing down?
item.description: Vaccinations in the US are slowing as infections rise - we've looked at where and why this is happening.

item.title: Covid: What happens when people no longer have to wear masks?
item.description: Face coverings became optional in many settings in England on Monday - what's the evidence for them?

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government has announced that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: Sajid Javid says NHS waiting lists will rise
item.description: The health secretary urges people to come forward and "know that the NHS is there for them".

item.title: Baby loss: 'Our world grows around the grief'
item.description: Ross Coniam set up the Dads and Lads Network for men who have gone through baby loss.

item.title: The nightclubs getting young people vaccinated
item.description: Venues across the UK are offering jabs in an effort to get more young people immunised.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Covid: Man, 23, 'thought body could brush off virus'
item.description: Patients at the Royal Liverpool Hospital tell BBC North West Tonight about being ill with Covid.
